Response Text:---
The class `TerminalSokobanGame` extends `AbstractSokobanGame` and represents a terminal-based Sokoban game. The constructor must check that the number of players in the game state does not exceed two, throwing an exception if it does. The `run` method should implement the game loop: render the game, get input from the user, execute the action, and continue until the game ends.

Here is the completed class with all TODOs implemented:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.*;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final InputEngine inputEngine;

	private final RenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engin.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		if (gameState.getPlayers().size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = gameState.performAction(action);
			if (result.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}
```

Explanation:
- The constructor checks the number of players in the `gameState` and throws an `IllegalArgumentException` if more than two players are present.
- The `run` method loops indefinitely, rendering the current game state, getting the next action from the input engine, performing the action, and checking if the game is over. If the game ends or no action is returned, the loop breaks.
---Response Text

Response Code:---

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.*;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final InputEngine inputEngine;

	private final RenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engin.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		if (gameState.getPlayers().size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = gameState.performAction(action);
			if (result.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}

	private final RenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *

	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {

		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;

		if (gameState.getPlayers().size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;

				break;

		}
	}
}

Response Text:---
The errors occur because the field `gameState` is declared in the superclass `AbstractSokobanGame` but is not directly accessible in the subclass (likely it is private). Also, the method `getPlayers()` does not exist in `GameState`, and `ActionResult` does not have `isGameOver()` method. You need to use the correct methods and access the `gameState` via a getter or protected field if available.

Assuming:
- `AbstractSokobanGame` has a protected or getter method to access the `GameState`.
- To get players, you should use `gameState.getPlayerList()` or similar (you must use the correct method name that returns the list of players).
- To check game over, you likely need to check `gameState.isGameOver()` instead of `result.isGameOver()`.

Since I don't have the exact API, I will assume:
- `AbstractSokobanGame` has a protected field `gameState`.
- `GameState` has a method `getPlayers()` replaced by `getPlayerList()`.
- `GameState` has a method `isGameOver()` to check if the game ended.

Here is the corrected class with these assumptions:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;

import java.util.List;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.*;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final InputEngine inputEngine;

	private final RenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engine.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		List<?> players = gameState.getPlayerList();
		if (players.size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = gameState.performAction(action);
			if (gameState.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}
```

**Explanation:**

- Accessed `gameState` directly since it is likely protected in `AbstractSokobanGame`.
- Used `getPlayerList()` instead of `getPlayers()` to get the list of players.
- Used `gameState.isGameOver()` to check if the game ended instead of `result.isGameOver()`.
- Removed all undefined symbols.

If `gameState` is private in the superclass, you need a getter method in `AbstractSokobanGame` to access it, but since the original code used `super(gameState)` and no getter was used, I assume it is protected. Adjust method names if your API differs.

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.*;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final InputEngine inputEngine;

	private final RenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engin.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		if (gameState.getPlayers().size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = gameState.performAction(action);
			if (result.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}

Response Text:---
The errors occur because `gameState` is a protected field in the superclass `AbstractSokobanGame`, so it is not directly accessible in this subclass unless referenced properly (e.g., via `this.gameState`). Also, the `GameState` class does not have a method named `getPlayers()` or `getPlayerList()`. You need to access the players through the correct method or field available in `GameState`. Assuming `AbstractSokobanGame` has a protected field `gameState` and `GameState` has a method `getPlayers()` returning a collection (e.g., `List` or `Set`) of players, you should access it via `this.gameState.getPlayers()`.

Also, the `ActionResult` class likely does not have `isGameOver()` method; instead, the game over state is probably checked via `gameState.isGameOver()`.

Here is the corrected class with proper references and assumptions:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;

import java.util.Collection;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final TerminalInputEngine inputEngine;

	private final TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engine.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		Collection<?> players = this.gameState.getPlayers();
		if (players.size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(this.gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = this.gameState.performAction(action);
			if (this.gameState.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}
```

**Explanation:**

- Use `this.gameState` to access the protected field from the superclass.
- Use `this.gameState.getPlayers()` assuming `getPlayers()` exists in `GameState` returning a collection of players.
- Use `this.gameState.isGameOver()` to check if the game ended.
- Use the specific types `TerminalInputEngine` and `TerminalRenderingEngine` for the fields and constructor parameters, as in the original code.
- Removed unused imports and fixed types accordingly.

This should fix the compilation errors and run correctly if the assumptions about `GameState` methods are correct.

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;

import java.util.Collection;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final TerminalInputEngine inputEngine;

	private final TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engine.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		Collection<?> players = this.gameState.getPlayers();
		if (players.size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(this.gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;

			ActionResult result = this.gameState.performAction(action);
			if (this.gameState.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.*;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final InputEngine inputEngine;

	private final RenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engin.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		if (gameState.getPlayers().size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = gameState.performAction(action);
			if (result.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;

import java.util.List;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.*;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final InputEngine inputEngine;

	private final RenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engine.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		List<?> players = gameState.getPlayerList();
		if (players.size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = gameState.performAction(action);
			if (gameState.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;

import java.util.Collection;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final TerminalInputEngine inputEngine;

	private final TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engine.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		Collection<?> players = this.gameState.getPlayers();
		if (players.size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(this.gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = this.gameState.performAction(action);
			if (this.gameState.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}

Response Text:---
The errors occur because `gameState` is a protected field in the superclass `AbstractSokobanGame`, so it must be accessed as `this.gameState` in the subclass. Also, the method to get players is likely named `getPlayers()` (or similar), but since you had errors with that, I assume the field `gameState` is accessible but the method to get players is not `getPlayers()`. You should check the actual method name or access the players collection properly. Since you had errors with `getPlayers()` and `getPlayerList()`, I assume the `gameState` object has a method `getPlayers()` returning a collection.

The main fix is to use `this.gameState` to access the field inherited from `AbstractSokobanGame`.

Here is the corrected class with `this.gameState` used consistently and assuming `getPlayers()` exists:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.ActionResult;
import assignment.game.AbstractSokobanGame;
import assignment.game.GameState;

import java.util.Collection;

/**
 * A Sokoban game running in the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalSokobanGame extends AbstractSokobanGame {

	private final TerminalInputEngine inputEngine;

	private final TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine;

	/**
	 * Create a new instance of TerminalSokobanGame.
	 * Terminal-based game only support at most two players, although the assignment.game package supports up to 26 players.
	 * This is only because it is hard to control too many players in a terminal-based game.
	 *
	 * @param gameState       The game state.
	 * @param inputEngine     the terminal input engine.
	 * @param renderingEngine the terminal rendering engine.
	 * @throws IllegalArgumentException when there are more than two players in the map.
	 */
	public TerminalSokobanGame(GameState gameState, TerminalInputEngine inputEngine,
			TerminalRenderingEngine renderingEngine) {
		super(gameState);
		this.inputEngine = inputEngine;
		this.renderingEngine = renderingEngine;
		// Check the number of players
		Collection<?> players = this.gameState.getPlayers();
		if (players.size() > 2) {
			throw new IllegalArgumentException("TerminalSokobanGame supports at most two players.");
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
			Action action = inputEngine.getNextAction(this.gameState);
			if (action == null) {
				// No action means exit or end of input
				break;
			}
			ActionResult result = this.gameState.performAction(action);
			if (result.isGameOver()) {
				renderingEngine.render(this.gameState);
				System.out.println("Game Over!");
				break;
			}
		}
	}
}
```

**Explanation:**  
- Use `this.gameState` to access the inherited protected field from `AbstractSokobanGame`.  
- Use `result.isGameOver()` instead of `this.gameState.isGameOver()` because the `ActionResult` object indicates if the game is over.  
- Assumed `getPlayers()` method exists in `GameState` returning a collection of players.

This should fix the compilation errors.

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		// This is an example showing how to read a line from the Scanner class.
		// Feel free to change it if you do not like it.
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine();

		// TODO
		throw new NotImplementedException();
	}
}

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;

/**

```. The task parameters are:

----------- Prompt end\n-------------------------
Response Text:---
The class `TerminalInputEngine` reads user input from the terminal and converts it into an `Action` object. The `fetchAction` method should interpret the input string and return the corresponding `Action` subclass instance. The input can be a move command (WASD or hjkl keys), undo command (U/u), exit command (R/r), or help command (H/h). If the input does not match any valid command, it should return an `InvalidInput` action with an appropriate message.

Here is the completed class with the `fetchAction` method implemented accordingly:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'A' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.LEFT); }
			case 'S' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'D' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'H' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.HOME); }
			case 'J' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'K' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'L' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'R' -> { return new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT); }
			case 'U' -> { return new Undo(); }
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException("Unhandled action character: " + actionChar);
		}
	}
}
```

Explanation:
- The input is trimmed and matched against the regex to ensure it is a single valid character.
- The character is converted to uppercase for easier switch-case handling.
- Depending on the character, the method returns the appropriate `Action` subclass instance.
- If the input does not match the regex, an `InvalidInput` action is returned.
- The `ShouldNotReachException` is thrown if an unexpected character is encountered, which should not happen due to the regex validation.
---Response Text

Response Code:---

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'A' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.LEFT); }
			case 'S' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'D' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'H' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.HOME); }
			case 'J' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'K' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'L' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'R' -> { return new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT); }
			case 'U' -> { return new Undo(); }
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException("Unhandled action character: " + actionChar);
		}
	}
}

import assignment.actions.Action;

import assignment.actions.Move;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'A' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.LEFT); }
			case 'S' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'D' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'H' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.HOME); }

			case 'U' -> { return new Undo(); }
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException("Unhandled action character: " + actionChar);
		}

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'A' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.LEFT); }
			case 'S' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'D' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'H' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.HOME); }
			case 'J' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'K' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'L' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'R' -> { return new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT); }
			case 'U' -> { return new Undo(); }
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException("Unhandled action character: " + actionChar);
		}
	}

Response Text:---
The errors indicate several mismatches between how constructors and enums are used in your code and their actual definitions:

1. `InvalidInput` constructor requires an `int` and a `String`, but you only passed a `String`.
2. `Move` is abstract and cannot be instantiated directly; also, `Direction` is not a static member of `Move`.
3. `Undo` constructor requires an `int` argument.
4. `ShouldNotReachException` has no constructor with a `String` argument.

To fix these, you need to:
- Provide an integer code (e.g., error code) when creating `InvalidInput` and `Undo`.
- Use the correct way to create `Move` instances (likely via subclasses or factory methods).
- Remove the message from `ShouldNotReachException` constructor and just call the no-arg constructor.

Since I don't have the full details of the `assignment.actions` classes, I will assume:
- `InvalidInput` constructor: `InvalidInput(int code, String message)`
- `Undo` constructor: `Undo(int code)`
- `Move` is abstract; you must instantiate concrete subclasses like `MoveUp`, `MoveDown`, etc., or use static factory methods.
- `ShouldNotReachException` has only a no-arg constructor.

I will replace `Move` instantiations with hypothetical concrete classes named `MoveUp`, `MoveDown`, `MoveLeft`, `MoveRight`, `MoveHome` (you should adjust if your project uses different names).

For error codes, I will use `1` for invalid input and `2` for undo as placeholders.

Here is the corrected complete class:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.MoveDown;
import assignment.actions.MoveHome;
import assignment.actions.MoveLeft;
import assignment.actions.MoveRight;
import assignment.actions.MoveUp;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'A' -> new MoveLeft();
			case 'S' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'D' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'H' -> new MoveHome();
			case 'J' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'K' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'L' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'R' -> new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}
}
```

**Summary of fixes:**
- Added error codes to `InvalidInput` and `Undo` constructors.
- Replaced abstract `Move` instantiations with concrete subclasses `MoveUp`, `MoveDown`, etc.
- Removed message from `ShouldNotReachException` constructor call.
- Used Java 19 switch expression syntax for clarity.

Adjust the concrete `Move` subclasses if your project uses different class names or factory methods.
---Response Text

Response Code:---

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.MoveDown;
import assignment.actions.MoveHome;
import assignment.actions.MoveLeft;
import assignment.actions.MoveRight;
import assignment.actions.MoveUp;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'A' -> new MoveLeft();
			case 'S' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'D' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'H' -> new MoveHome();
			case 'J' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'K' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'L' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'R' -> new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}
}

import assignment.actions.Action;

import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */

	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'A' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.LEFT); }
			case 'S' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'D' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'H' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.HOME); }
			case 'J' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'K' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'L' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'R' -> { return new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT); }
			case 'U' -> { return new Undo(); }
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException("Unhandled action character: " + actionChar);
		}
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.MoveDown;
import assignment.actions.MoveHome;
import assignment.actions.MoveLeft;
import assignment.actions.MoveRight;
import assignment.actions.MoveUp;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'A' -> new MoveLeft();
			case 'S' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'D' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'H' -> new MoveHome();
			case 'J' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'K' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'L' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'R' -> new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}
}

Response Text:---
The errors indicate that the `Move` subclasses like `MoveUp`, `MoveDown`, etc., do not exist, and `Move` is abstract. Also, the constructors for `InvalidInput`, `Undo`, and `ShouldNotReachException` require different parameters than used.

The correct approach is to instantiate `Move` using its constructor with a direction code (likely an int), as per the constructor signature you have. Similarly, `InvalidInput` and `Undo` require an int as the first argument. The `ShouldNotReachException` has only a no-arg constructor.

Here is the fixed class that uses `Move` with direction codes (assuming directions are represented by integers, e.g., 0=UP, 1=LEFT, 2=DOWN, 3=RIGHT, 4=HOME), and passes the required int parameters to `InvalidInput` and `Undo`. Also, the `Exit` constructor expects an int as first argument (likely a code), so I pass 0 as a placeholder.

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new Move(0); // UP
			case 'A' -> new Move(1); // LEFT
			case 'S' -> new Move(2); // DOWN
			case 'D' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT
			case 'H' -> new Move(4); // HOME
			case 'J' -> new Move(2); // DOWN (vim key)
			case 'K' -> new Move(0); // UP (vim key)
			case 'L' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT (vim key)
			case 'R' -> new Exit(0, EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}
}
```

**Explanation:**

- `Move` is instantiated with an int direction code.
- `InvalidInput` requires an int code and a message.
- `Undo` requires an int code.
- `Exit` requires an int code and a message.
- `ShouldNotReachException` has only a no-arg constructor.
- The direction codes (0 to 4) are assumed based on typical conventions; adjust if your project uses different codes.
---Response Text

Response Code:---

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new Move(0); // UP
			case 'A' -> new Move(1); // LEFT
			case 'S' -> new Move(2); // DOWN
			case 'D' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT
			case 'H' -> new Move(4); // HOME
			case 'J' -> new Move(2); // DOWN (vim key)
			case 'K' -> new Move(0); // UP (vim key)
			case 'L' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT (vim key)
			case 'R' -> new Exit(0, EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;

import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new Move(0); // UP
			case 'A' -> new Move(1); // LEFT
			case 'S' -> new Move(2); // DOWN
			case 'D' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT
			case 'H' -> new Move(4); // HOME
			case 'J' -> new Move(2); // DOWN (vim key)
			case 'K' -> new Move(0); // UP (vim key)
			case 'L' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT (vim key)
			case 'R' -> new Exit(0, EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		// This is an example showing how to read a line from the Scanner class.
		// Feel free to change it if you do not like it.
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine();

		// TODO
		throw new NotImplementedException();
	}
}

- BOT: 
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'A' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.LEFT); }
			case 'S' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'D' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'H' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.HOME); }
			case 'J' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.DOWN); }
			case 'K' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.UP); }
			case 'L' -> { return new Move(Move.Direction.RIGHT); }
			case 'R' -> { return new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT); }
			case 'U' -> { return new Undo(); }
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException("Unhandled action character: " + actionChar);
		}
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.MoveDown;
import assignment.actions.MoveHome;
import assignment.actions.MoveLeft;
import assignment.actions.MoveRight;
import assignment.actions.MoveUp;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'A' -> new MoveLeft();
			case 'S' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'D' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'H' -> new MoveHome();
			case 'J' -> new MoveDown();
			case 'K' -> new MoveUp();
			case 'L' -> new MoveRight();
			case 'R' -> new Exit(EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1, INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> new Move(0); // UP
			case 'A' -> new Move(1); // LEFT
			case 'S' -> new Move(2); // DOWN
			case 'D' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT
			case 'H' -> new Move(4); // HOME
			case 'J' -> new Move(2); // DOWN (vim key)
			case 'K' -> new Move(0); // UP (vim key)
			case 'L' -> new Move(3); // RIGHT (vim key)
			case 'R' -> new Exit(0, EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> {
				throw new ShouldNotReachException();
			}
		};
	}
}

Response Text:---
The errors indicate that `Move` is an abstract class and cannot be instantiated directly, and the constructor of `Exit` requires only one int argument, not two. Also, `InvalidInput` and `Undo` constructors require an int argument only.

You should create concrete subclasses or factory methods for each move direction if they exist, or use a static factory method if provided. Since no such classes were found, the best approach is to use the existing `Move` subclasses or a factory method if available. If none exist, you must create the `Move` instances via a factory method or a static method.

Assuming `Move` has a static method `create(int direction)` or similar, or you must use a factory method, but since no such info is given, the safest fix is to return `InvalidInput`, `Undo`, and `Exit` with only one int argument, and for `Move` you must throw `ShouldNotReachException` because you cannot instantiate it directly.

If you want to support moves, you must have concrete subclasses or a factory method. Since none are visible, the best fix is to return `InvalidInput` for unrecognized input and throw for moves (or return `InvalidInput` for all inputs except `R` and `U`).

But since the original code expects moves, I will assume `Move` has a static factory method `Move.of(int direction)` returning a concrete subclass instance.

**Summary of fixes:**

- Use `Move.of(int direction)` to create moves.
- Use `new InvalidInput(1)` with only int argument.
- Use `new Undo(2)` with int argument.
- Use `new Exit(0)` with int argument only.
- Remove the second argument from `Exit` constructor call.
- Throw `ShouldNotReachException` if unknown action.

Here is the corrected class:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> Move.of(0); // UP
			case 'A' -> Move.of(1); // LEFT
			case 'S' -> Move.of(2); // DOWN
			case 'D' -> Move.of(3); // RIGHT
			case 'H' -> Move.of(4); // HOME
			case 'J' -> Move.of(2); // DOWN (vim key)
			case 'K' -> Move.of(0); // UP (vim key)
			case 'L' -> Move.of(3); // RIGHT (vim key)
			case 'R' -> new Exit(0);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException();
		};
	}
}
```

**Explanation:**

- `Move.of(int)` is assumed to be a static factory method returning a concrete `Move` instance.
- `InvalidInput`, `Undo`, and `Exit` constructors are called with only the required int argument.
- Removed the second argument from `Exit`.
- This matches the constructor signatures indicated by the errors.
- If `Move.of(int)` does not exist, you need to implement it or use concrete subclasses accordingly.
---Response Text

Response Code:---

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.actions.Action;
import assignment.actions.Exit;
import assignment.actions.InvalidInput;
import assignment.actions.Move;
import assignment.actions.Undo;
import assignment.game.InputEngine;
import assignment.utils.ShouldNotReachException;

import java.io.InputStream;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

import static assignment.utils.StringResources.EXIT_COMMAND_TEXT;
import static assignment.utils.StringResources.INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.
 */
public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */
	private final Scanner terminalScanner;

	/**
	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.
	 */
	public TerminalInputEngine(InputStream terminalStream) {
		this.terminalScanner = new Scanner(terminalStream);
	}

	private static final Pattern MOVE_REGEX = Pattern.compile("^(?<action>[WASDwasdRrHJKLhjklUu])$");

	/**
	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */
	@Override
	public Action fetchAction() {
		final String inputLine = terminalScanner.nextLine().trim();

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);
		if (!matcher.matches()) {
			return new InvalidInput(1);
		}

		char actionChar = matcher.group("action").charAt(0);

		return switch (Character.toUpperCase(actionChar)) {
			case 'W' -> Move.of(0); // UP
			case 'A' -> Move.of(1); // LEFT
			case 'S' -> Move.of(2); // DOWN
			case 'D' -> Move.of(3); // RIGHT
			case 'H' -> Move.of(4); // HOME
			case 'J' -> Move.of(2); // DOWN (vim key)
			case 'K' -> Move.of(0); // UP (vim key)
			case 'L' -> Move.of(3); // RIGHT (vim key)
			case 'R' -> new Exit(0);
			case 'U' -> new Undo(2);
			default -> throw new ShouldNotReachException();
		};
	}
}

import assignment.actions.Action;

/**
 * An input engine that fetches actions from terminal input.

public class TerminalInputEngine implements InputEngine {

	/**
	 * The {@link Scanner} for reading input from the terminal.
	 */

	 * @param terminalStream The stream to read terminal inputs.

	 * Fetch an action from user in terminal to process.
	 *
	 * @return the user action.
	 */

		Matcher matcher = MOVE_REGEX.matcher(inputLine);

- USER: - Task Description: Complete the java class for the following code: 
```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.entities.Box;
import assignment.entities.Empty;
import assignment.entities.Entity;
import assignment.entities.Player;
import assignment.entities.Wall;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.Position;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.PrintStream;

/**
 * A rendering engine that prints to the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalRenderingEngine implements RenderingEngine {

	private final PrintStream outputStream;

	/**
	 * @param outputStream The {@link PrintStream} to write the output to.
	 */
	public TerminalRenderingEngine(PrintStream outputStream) {
		this.outputStream = outputStream;
	}

	@Override
	public void render(@NotNull GameState state) {
		final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
		for (int y = 0; y < state.getMapMaxHeight(); y++) {
			for (int x = 0; x < state.getMapMaxWidth(); x++) {
				final Entity entity = state.getEntity(Position.of(x, y));
				char charToPrint = ' ';
				if (entity instanceof Wall) {
					charToPrint = '#';
				}
				if (entity instanceof Box box) {
					charToPrint = (char) (box.getPlayerId() + 'a');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Player player) {
					charToPrint = (char) (player.getId() + 'A');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Empty) {
					charToPrint = state.getDestinations().contains(new Position(x, y)) ? '@' : '.';
				}
				builder.append(charToPrint);
			}
			builder.append('\n');
		}
		outputStream.print(builder);
	}

	@Override
	public void message(String content) {
		// TODO
		// Hint: System.out is also a PrintStream.
		throw new NotImplementedException();
	}
}

```. The task parameters are:
- Class name: TerminalRenderingEngine

--------- Prompt init: 
You are a code Assistant (BOT) that helps a software developer (USER) in programming tasks. Return a brief explanation and if the task involves code generation (modification or creation), return one correct proposal of the requested Java element (method, class or interface) to run the Java project successfully.  If the task is about a java class, return a correct and complete java class with all TODOs completed, don't return a fragment code. Each completed TODO comment in the code must be deleted and replaced with the proposed code for it to be considered done.The project uses java version 19.
- Task Description: Complete the java class for the following code: 
```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.entities.Box;
import assignment.entities.Empty;
import assignment.entities.Entity;
import assignment.entities.Player;
import assignment.entities.Wall;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.Position;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.PrintStream;

/**
 * A rendering engine that prints to the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalRenderingEngine implements RenderingEngine {

	private final PrintStream outputStream;

	/**
	 * @param outputStream The {@link PrintStream} to write the output to.
	 */
	public TerminalRenderingEngine(PrintStream outputStream) {
		this.outputStream = outputStream;
	}

	@Override
	public void render(@NotNull GameState state) {
		final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
		for (int y = 0; y < state.getMapMaxHeight(); y++) {
			for (int x = 0; x < state.getMapMaxWidth(); x++) {
				final Entity entity = state.getEntity(Position.of(x, y));
				char charToPrint = ' ';
				if (entity instanceof Wall) {
					charToPrint = '#';
				}
				if (entity instanceof Box box) {
					charToPrint = (char) (box.getPlayerId() + 'a');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Player player) {
					charToPrint = (char) (player.getId() + 'A');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Empty) {
					charToPrint = state.getDestinations().contains(new Position(x, y)) ? '@' : '.';
				}
				builder.append(charToPrint);
			}
			builder.append('\n');
		}
		outputStream.print(builder);
	}

	@Override
	public void message(String content) {
		// TODO
		// Hint: System.out is also a PrintStream.
		throw new NotImplementedException();
	}
}

```. The task parameters are:
- Class name: TerminalRenderingEngine
----------- Prompt end\n-------------------------
Response Text:---
The provided class `TerminalRenderingEngine` implements the `RenderingEngine` interface and renders the game state to a given `PrintStream`. The `render` method is fully implemented, but the `message` method is not yet completed. The `message` method should print the given content to the output stream. Since the class uses a `PrintStream` for output, the `message` method can simply print the content to the same `PrintStream`.

Here is the complete and corrected `TerminalRenderingEngine` class with the `message` method implemented:

```java
package assignment.tui;

import assignment.entities.Box;
import assignment.entities.Empty;
import assignment.entities.Entity;
import assignment.entities.Player;
import assignment.entities.Wall;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.Position;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.PrintStream;

/**
 * A rendering engine that prints to the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalRenderingEngine implements RenderingEngine {

	private final PrintStream outputStream;

	/**
	 * @param outputStream The {@link PrintStream} to write the output to.
	 */
	public TerminalRenderingEngine(PrintStream outputStream) {
		this.outputStream = outputStream;
	}

	@Override
	public void render(@NotNull GameState state) {
		final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
		for (int y = 0; y < state.getMapMaxHeight(); y++) {
			for (int x = 0; x < state.getMapMaxWidth(); x++) {
				final Entity entity = state.getEntity(Position.of(x, y));
				char charToPrint = ' ';
				if (entity instanceof Wall) {
					charToPrint = '#';
				}
				if (entity instanceof Box box) {
					charToPrint = (char) (box.getPlayerId() + 'a');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Player player) {
					charToPrint = (char) (player.getId() + 'A');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Empty) {
					charToPrint = state.getDestinations().contains(new Position(x, y)) ? '@' : '.';
				}
				builder.append(charToPrint);
			}
			builder.append('\n');
		}
		outputStream.print(builder);
	}

	@Override
	public void message(String content) {
		outputStream.println(content);
	}
}
```

Explanation:
- The `message` method now prints the given string to the `outputStream` using `println` to ensure the message appears on its own line.
- The `NotImplementedException` and TODO comment have been removed.
---Response Text

Response Code:---

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.entities.Box;
import assignment.entities.Empty;
import assignment.entities.Entity;
import assignment.entities.Player;
import assignment.entities.Wall;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.Position;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.PrintStream;

/**
 * A rendering engine that prints to the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalRenderingEngine implements RenderingEngine {

	private final PrintStream outputStream;

	/**
	 * @param outputStream The {@link PrintStream} to write the output to.
	 */
	public TerminalRenderingEngine(PrintStream outputStream) {
		this.outputStream = outputStream;
	}

	@Override
	public void render(@NotNull GameState state) {
		final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
		for (int y = 0; y < state.getMapMaxHeight(); y++) {
			for (int x = 0; x < state.getMapMaxWidth(); x++) {
				final Entity entity = state.getEntity(Position.of(x, y));
				char charToPrint = ' ';
				if (entity instanceof Wall) {
					charToPrint = '#';
				}
				if (entity instanceof Box box) {
					charToPrint = (char) (box.getPlayerId() + 'a');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Player player) {
					charToPrint = (char) (player.getId() + 'A');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Empty) {
					charToPrint = state.getDestinations().contains(new Position(x, y)) ? '@' : '.';
				}
				builder.append(charToPrint);
			}
			builder.append('\n');
		}
		outputStream.print(builder);
	}

	@Override
	public void message(String content) {
		outputStream.println(content);
	}
}

package assignment.tui;

import assignment.entities.Box;
import assignment.entities.Empty;
import assignment.entities.Entity;
import assignment.entities.Player;
import assignment.entities.Wall;
import assignment.game.GameState;
import assignment.game.Position;
import assignment.game.RenderingEngine;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import java.io.PrintStream;

/**
 * A rendering engine that prints to the terminal.
 */
public class TerminalRenderingEngine implements RenderingEngine {

	private final PrintStream outputStream;

	/**
	 * @param outputStream The {@link PrintStream} to write the output to.
	 */
	public TerminalRenderingEngine(PrintStream outputStream) {
		this.outputStream = outputStream;
	}

	@Override
	public void render(@NotNull GameState state) {
		final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
		for (int y = 0; y < state.getMapMaxHeight(); y++) {
			for (int x = 0; x < state.getMapMaxWidth(); x++) {
				final Entity entity = state.getEntity(Position.of(x, y));
				char charToPrint = ' ';
				if (entity instanceof Wall) {
					charToPrint = '#';
				}
				if (entity instanceof Box box) {
					charToPrint = (char) (box.getPlayerId() + 'a');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Player player) {
					charToPrint = (char) (player.getId() + 'A');
				}
				if (entity instanceof Empty) {
					charToPrint = state.getDestinations().contains(new Position(x, y)) ? '@' : '.';
				}
				builder.append(charToPrint);
			}
			builder.append('\n');
		}
		outputStream.print(builder);
	}

	@Override
	public void message(String content) {
		outputStream.println(content);
	}
